Another example, for a family of four in Texas, for parents making  $70,000 a year but don't just get insurance through their jobs, their  insurance would cost $505 in 2025, but without the extended premium tax  credit, likely to face $1,551 cost per month in 2026.

So these costs are adding up on American families. Together, these  costs…
